sentence.Network_en: He is sparkling and versatile in front of the camera.
sentence.Network_cn: 镜头前的他光彩照人，多才多艺。

sentence.Network_en: If you can't run to champagne, buy sparkling wine.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果买不起香槟酒，就买汽酒好了。

sentence.Network_en: Sparkling wine can also put you in the party spirit.
sentence.Network_cn: 汽酒还可以提高玩乐的兴致。

entry.def: If a company is described as having sparkling figures or sparkling results, it has performed very well and made a lot of money.

example.ex: Top retailer Marks & Spencer has romped in with another set of sparkling results.
example.tran: 零售巨头玛莎百货再次凭借一系列耀眼的成绩轻松胜出。

means.word_mean: 1. a rapid change in brightness; a brief spark or flash
1. shining with brilliant points of light like stars;
2. marked by high spirits or excitement;
3. used of wines and waters; charged naturally or artificially with carbon dioxide;
4. having brief brilliant points or flashes of light;

sentences.sentence: "his glittering eyes were cold and malevolent"
"shop window full of glittering Christmas trees"

sentences.en: A galaxy of twinkling stars matched the thousands of sparkling city lights.
sentences.cn: 闪烁的繁星与城内闪耀的万家灯火交相辉映。

sentences.en: The young workers brought forth some sparkling new suggestions for improving our product.
sentences.cn: 这些青年工人为提高产品质量,提出了顶呱呱的新建议。

sentences.en: After 25 years, the curtain has finally gone down on his sparkling career.
sentences.cn: 25年之后,他终于告别了辉煌的职业生涯。

sentences.en: Other sparkling wines are often considered the poor relations of champagne.
sentences.cn: 其他起泡的葡萄酒通常被认为较香槟酒为次。

sentences.en: Try some of this sparkling white wine—the poor man’s champagne.
sentences.cn: 尝尝这种白葡萄汽酒吧,这是穷人的香槟酒。

sentences.en: She seemed quite far gone, even though she’d only had two glasses of sparkling wine.
sentences.cn: 尽管她只喝了两杯汽酒,但看上去好像已醉得稀里糊涂了。
